Temperature affects the fraction of the eigenchannels

The inclusion of temperature leads to an increase in
the initial population of the excited state,
quently there is a larger fraction of the eigenchannel
(with the lowest Coulomb barrier) in the entrance chan-

creasing temperature,which is supported by our results
in Fig. 3. Hence there is an enhancement of fusion prob-

Summary. We have addressed an area of unexplored
territory by assessing the need for the inclusion of a reac-
tion medium in stellar heavy-ion fusion calculations.The

include thermal and atomic effects on subbarrier fusion
dynamics. The calculations show that plasma tempera-
ture strongly enhances fusion probability. This pioneer-
ingeffort suggests that careful considerations should be
made when modeling or performing experiments on col-
lision partners with low-lying excited states at high tem-
perature. Despite no changes in fusion probability due to
atomic effects, there is scope to reintroduce these effects

on the theory of open quantum systems,unambiguously
include thermal and atomic effects on subbarrier fusion
